---
title: "dco.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML configuration file, located at `.github/dco.yml`, is used to configure the Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO) app for a GitHub repository. It specifically sets the requirement for organization members to sign off on their commits.

## Symbols

### `require`
#### Description
The `require` key is used to specify requirements for the DCO app.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| members | boolean | Determines whether organization members are required to sign off on their commits |

#### Internal Logic
The `members` field is set to `false`, which means that organization members are not required to sign off on their commits when using the DCO app.

## Dependencies
| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| DCO app | This configuration file is used by the Developer Certificate of Origin (DCO) app on GitHub |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| require.members | boolean | false | Specifies whether organization members need to sign off on their commits |

## References
The configuration file includes a comment with a reference to the DCO app's documentation:
```yaml
# https://github.com/dcoapp/app?tab=readme-ov-file#skipping-sign-off-for-organization-members
```
This link provides more information about skipping sign-off for organization members.
